required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Thrombus Aspiration in STEMI Patients With High Thrombus Burden
clinical_study.official_title: Thrombus Aspiration in Primary Percutaneous Coronary Intervention for STEMI Patients With High Thrombus Burden

collaborator.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Guangxi Medical University
Fifth Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, multicenter, open-label, randomized, controlled, parallel group study, in which ST-Segment Elevation Myocardial Infarction (STEMI) patients with high thrombus burden(TIMI thrombus grade ≥3) are included. Patients are randomized to be treated with or without manual thrombus aspiration(TA) during primary percutaneous coronary intervention(PPCI) by a ratio of 1:1.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is intended to explore the efficacy of thrombus aspiration (TA) in ST-Segment Elevation Myocardial Infarction (STEMI) patients with high thrombus burden who received primary PCI within 12 hours after the onset of symptoms，reducing the incidence of cardiovascular death, recurrent myocardial infarction, stent thrombosis, target vessel revascularization within 180 days or stroke in 30 days.

primary_outcome.description: The first occurrence of cardiovascular death, recurrent myocardial infarction, stent thrombosis or target vessel revascularization

secondary_outcome.description: The symptoms continuing for more than 24 hours or leading to death with no apparent cause other than vascular
The first occurence of cardiovascular death, recurrent myocardial infarction, stent thrombosis, target vessel revascularization or stroke.

arm_group.description: Upfront manual thrombus aspiration followed by PCI
PCI without upfront manual thrombus aspiration

intervention.description: Percutaneous Coronary Intervention with manual aspiration thrombectomy
Percutaneous Coronary Intervention without manual aspiration thrombectomy
